programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Gold Day In Hell: Les discovers Seth's masterplan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son. (S5, ep 13)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Wreck-Shaw: Allen drags a starving Ton to a weekend auction and some newbie buyers try to eat up all the profit. Will the guys go home hungry? (S5, ep 13)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Carnies & Amories: A tough group of bidders team up to take down Ton and Allen at auction. After a couple of wins, the guys try to sell an arsenal used by Native Americans. (S5, ep 14)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The Unsinkable Ton: Unique finds lead the guys to some cool sales. They try to authenticate props from the film Titanic, and Ton faces off with a rattler. (S5, ep 15)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Pucks For Bucks: The guys get stuck with a unit they didn't want and have to sort through trash to make their bottom line. (S5, ep 16)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Astronaut Encounters: To this day, NASA denies all UFO accounts and has taken measures to prevent its astronauts from telling their stories. But what are they hiding? (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Atmospheric Anomalies: Some experts believe many atmospheric light shows are actually caused by extraterrestrials. If so, do they pose an imminent threat to humanity? (S3, ep 4)

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The Mystery Of The Cyclops: Experts investigate whether an advanced civilisation of giants built Malta's mysterious megaliths. Could they have had extraterrestrial help? (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: In 1966, a class of Melbourne students spot a UFO and are told never to speak of the incident. A man's car dies in 2009 after he spots a cigar-shaped object in the New York sky. (S1, ep 5)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: A teenager sees a mushroom-shaped object appear in the field while feeding his sheep in 1971. In 2000, police officers in Illinois chase a triangular UFO the size of a house. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: A tunnel gains a terrifying reputation when hundreds of vehicles crash, seemingly without cause. Meanwhile, a strange creature is witnessed following a nuclear accident. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: America's Loch Ness Monster: A Loch Ness Monster-esque creature is recorded in America, experts analyse evidence of a giant scaly egg, and birds are vaporized by a death ray. (S2, ep 2)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: Curse of the Mayan Treasure: An explorer at a Mayan sacrificial site is attacked by an underwater fog, thousands of fish jump to their deaths, and a UFO is spotted in LA skies. (S2, ep 3)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: Curse of the Monster Spider: A massive spider's web takes over a park, and experts investigate if this monster's trap could capture a human. A tree spurts out thick red blood. (S2, ep 10)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: The Incident at Area 51: Near Area 51, a police convoy is filmed transporting an alien-looking craft in the dead of night. Strange beams of light are reported in Argentina. (S2, ep 11)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: When something strange is recorded flying in Mexico, some wonder if it's a witch reputed to kidnap children. (S3, ep 7)

programme.title: Digging For Britain
programme.desc: Roman Bathhouse and Hessian Camp: Alice Roberts shares archaeological discoveries from the west of the UK, including a Roman bath house and a German camp. (2 of 4)

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: The Italian Job: While a new discovery is made in the triangle-shaped swamp, Rick and members of the team find links between the Knights Templar and the Oak Island mystery. (S10, ep 23)

programme.title: New: U-Boat Wargamers
programme.desc: False Dawns: France falls in 1940 and Donitz's U-boats embark on a race to sink British merchant ships. Roberts' wargaming ideas are at last entertained by a desperate Admiralty. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: New: Viking Dead
programme.desc: Mysteries of the Oseberg: A preserved Viking ship was found in Norway in 1903. Buried with the ship were two skeletons, but does the evidence point to a sacrifice or a funeral? (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: Lost Relic Hunters
programme.desc: The Chalice: The most stunning relic in Hamilton and Carl's collection - the black obsidian chalice - is examined. The pair then head to Portugal to hunt for clues about it. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi fantasy with new-comer Raffiella Chapman and Eddie Marsan. A resourceful teenager scavenges to survive in a mushy and mushroom-y post-apocalyptic world of have and have-nots.

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: (1987) Classic 80s dystopian thriller, based on a Stephen King novel. Gadget-wielding murderers hunt an innocent man (Arnold Schwarzenegger) on a sick TV show.

programme.title: Misery
programme.desc: (1990) Thriller with Kathy Bates and James Caan. An obsessed fan rescues her favourite writer from a car crash, but then imprisons him... It's the hobbling that really curls the toes!

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: (1956) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a cavalry officer who's accused of cowardice when he can't prove why he wasn't present at the Little Big Horn massacre.

programme.title: Siege at Red River
programme.desc: (1954) Western. Van Johnson stars as a Confederate agent who steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees and attempts to smuggle it south through enemy lines to his own side.

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: A Room with a View
programme.desc: (1985) Helena Bonham Carter stars in this Merchant/Ivory film as an innocent on holiday in Florence, where a meeting with Julian Sands leads to romance.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: (2019) Visually stunning sci-fi starring Brad Pitt as a famously cool astronaut sent to the edges of the solar system to save Earth from deadly power surges. With Tommy Lee Jones.

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: (1972) A Mafia don's son struggles to become a legitimate businessman in Francis Ford Coppola's classic crime drama. Starring Al Pacino, Marlon Brando, James Caan and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: The Motorcycle Diaries
programme.desc: (2004) Gael Garcia Bernal stars in Walter Salles' film as a young Che Guevara whose journey through South America realises his radical ideas. In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: (2011) Animated Wild West comedy with Johnny Depp. A pet chameleon accidentally becomes the sheriff of small frontier town, Dirt. Can he defend it? Oh, and he's got a mate called Roadkill.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Howards End
programme.desc: (1992) Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Emma Thompson star in James Ivory's adaptation of EM Forster's novel about two families, love, treachery and revenge.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: (2007) Action adventure. Shia LaBeouf gets caught up in a battle between two groups of violent shape-shifting robots, one of which - the Decepticons - is out to destroy humanity.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.
programme.desc: (1966) Raquel Welch - in her famous fur bikini - stars in this prehistoric adventure set in an inhospitable landscape populated by two warring tribes and Ray Harryhausen's roving dinosaurs.

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: (2006) Biographical drama starring Will Smith as Chris Gardner, the down-on-his-luck salesman who risked it all to provide a better life for himself and his son.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death...
programme.desc: ...of Michael Corleone: The 2020 cut of The Godfather Part III, starring Al Pacino and Diane Keaton. Michael tries to go straight and wrestles with his past.

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi fantasy with new-comer Raffiella Chapman and Eddie Marsan. A resourceful teenager scavenges to survive in a mushy and mushroom-y post-apocalyptic world of have and have-nots.

programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his green room, including star of stage and screen Brian Cox, Mad Men actress Christina Hendricks, Dancing on Ice judge Oti Mabuse and Strictly champion Chris McCausland. Plus, music by Snow Patrol

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Emergency nurses Jess, Hayley and Connor treat two bizarre injuries, Charlie and Gerry race to stabilise a RTC victim, and Toni treats a teen after a stunt.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Contestants get the chance to win the biggest cash prize in British TV history with a limitless jackpot. First up are Joe and sister-in-law Jo, who have been prepping by going round the supermarket sizing things up with a tape measure, followed by Steve and son-in-law Jordan, who hope their approach will help propel them into the truly life-changing sums of money on the ladder

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team of antiques dealers are at Newark Showground in Nottinghamshire where Simon Schneider is literally throwing money around and a seller tells the story of the valuable silver tankard they've brought with them that was dug up by Jixxy the cat. Mark Stevens has to phone a friend when faced with a table full of Royal Albert ceramics

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray, with father and son Greg and Dean from Manchester, Bolton vicar Tony and his wife Doreen, and sisters Saira and Farrah from Reading taking part. They work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Dylan originally from Llan Ffestiniog, Jade from Exmouth, Rachel from London, Tom from Morpeth and thousands of pounds is the matter of one of the country's finest quiz brains. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Villagers grieve, the police have questions, and a relationship breaks down

programme.title: Live UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: Portugal v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening Group A3 match, held at Estadio Municipal de Portimao. England are unbeaten in their last three meetings with Portugal, drawing one and winning two, and both teams will be determined to get off to a winning start in a strong group also containing Belgium and world champions Spain. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Olivia confronts the boys with their worst nightmare: will they hand over their phones to their girlfriends?

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as 10 amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a coveted dream job as a junior fashion designer for high street giant M&S. Over six episodes, the competitors will be tested on their design, problem-solving, commerciality and collaboration skills and judged by a panel of senior leaders at the company alongside a rotation of celebrity guests and designers. In their first challenge, the contestants are tasked with creating womenswear clothing under the watchful eye of guest judge Mel B

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Ben and Georgie Ainslie into his kitchen to sample some recipes from Cyrus Todiwala and Jose Pizarro. Merlin Griffiths is at the bar crafting cocktails

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: James heads east to the region of Jura where he barbecues duck and uses the apple and pears of a local orchard. Plus, he visits the home of Comte cheese!

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Rishi Persad presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Pendil Novices' Chase from Kempton Park, plus the Eider Chase at Newcastle, and the Winter Derby from Southwell. Analysis from Luke Harvey and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and plus commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Johnnie Beattie and Ugo Monye, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Jim Hamilton, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli return to the judging panel with special guest judge KSI

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes restaurateur Gordon Ramsay, actor Danny Dyer, stage and screen star Vanessa Williams, 2024 Sports Personality of the Year Keely Hodgkinson and star of Babygirl Harris Dickinson to his sofa. Plus, a performance by singer-songwriter Joan Armatrading

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Bianca Devins: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: A young woman in upstate New York is murdered and the killer posts footage of his heinous crime all over social media - when her family are sent the gruesome images of the crime before the police have had a chance to confirm what has happened, the family are then forced to battle social media platforms to remove the awful evidence from the internet

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Sunderland v Hull City at Stadium of Light, Swansea City v Blackburn Rovers at Swansea.com Stadium and Portsmouth v Queens Park Rangers at Fratton Park in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: The teams sharpen their knives for a new challenge: preparing the ultimate steak dinner to avoid the first knockout competition.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by ITV News Royal Editor Chris Ship, Vanity Fair's Royal Correspondent Katie Nicholl, and royal commentator Afua Hagan to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Ben and Georgie Ainslie into his kitchen to sample some recipes from Cyrus Todiwala and Jose Pizarro. Merlin Griffiths is at the bar crafting cocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Felicity Kendal, Nigel Havers and Jessica Hynes join Alan and Meirion Owen gives a lesson in sheepdog training. Camilla Bassett-Smith and Chris Hull spruce up the green house and Ian Burrell makes rum cocktails for all seasons

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Leicestershire, Alan and the team head to the town of Hinckley to surprise 96-year-old Second World War veteran Gordon with a stunning garden transformation. Alan sets about bringing a classic beautiful English country garden to this inaccessible space that includes raised beds in dry stone walls, a sociable seating area, a mini-orchard and an outdoor room

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Eddie Kadi lead contestants on a mission to draw images that match a word or phrase from a specific category. The team-mates will have to guess correctly to score. Game show, hosted by Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the five remaining couples perform routines inspired by well-known musicals in hope of securing a place in the semi-final. Plus, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe open the show and the cast of Moulin Rouge! The Musical bring the West End to the ice

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Laura Kenny and Krishnan Guru-Murthy answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. If they get stuck, they have four lifelines available, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Lies are uncovered as Mel and Asif are taken into custody, Juliet tries to protect Taylor and herself against the investigation, a possible witness to the body's disposal is found, and Jess plans a conversation with Steve

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz. A chance encounter at an airport with spy Roy Miller embroils mechanic June Havens in a frantic and life-threatening chase across the globe. But can June really trust this man of mystery, especially given his penchant for rendering her unconscious when trouble rears its head?

programme.title: Forced Adoption: Britain's Silent Scandal - Tonight
programme.desc: In the four decades after the Second World War, more than 200,000 women were forced to give up their babies for adoption through practices run by church and state. Decades later, many are still traumatised and unable to reconnect with the children they never wanted to give up. Sarah Corker meets those campaigning for a formal apology from the UK government

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Villagers grieve, the police have questions, and a relationship breaks down

programme.title: Live UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: Portugal v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening Group A3 match, held at Estadio Municipal de Portimao. England are unbeaten in their last three meetings with Portugal, drawing one and winning two, and both teams will be determined to get off to a winning start in a strong group also containing Belgium and world champions Spain. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Olivia confronts the boys with their worst nightmare: will they hand over their phones to their girlfriends?

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as 10 amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a coveted dream job as a junior fashion designer for high street giant M&S. Over six episodes, the competitors will be tested on their design, problem-solving, commerciality and collaboration skills and judged by a panel of senior leaders at the company alongside a rotation of celebrity guests and designers. In their first challenge, the contestants are tasked with creating womenswear clothing under the watchful eye of guest judge Mel B

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: James heads east to the region of Jura where he barbecues duck and uses the apple and pears of a local orchard. Plus, he visits the home of Comte cheese!

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Rishi Persad presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Pendil Novices' Chase from Kempton Park, plus the Eider Chase at Newcastle, and the Winter Derby from Southwell. Analysis from Luke Harvey and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and plus commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Johnnie Beattie and Ugo Monye, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Jim Hamilton, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli return to the judging panel with special guest judge KSI

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Leicestershire, Alan and the team head to the town of Hinckley to surprise 96-year-old Second World War veteran Gordon with a stunning garden transformation. programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Eddie Kadi lead contestants on a mission to draw images that match a word or phrase from a specific category. The team-mates will have to guess correctly to score. Game show, hosted by Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the five remaining couples perform routines inspired by well-known musicals in hope of securing a place in the semi-final. programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray, with father and son Greg and Dean from Manchester, Bolton vicar Tony and his wife Doreen, and sisters Saira and Farrah from Reading taking part. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: All that stands between Dylan originally from Llan Ffestiniog, Jade from Exmouth, Rachel from London, Tom from Morpeth and thousands of pounds is the matter of one of the country's finest quiz brains. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Villagers grieve, the police have questions, and a relationship breaks down

programme.title: Live UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: Portugal v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening Group A3 match, held at Estadio Municipal de Portimao. England are unbeaten in their last three meetings with Portugal, drawing one and winning two, and both teams will be determined to get off to a winning start in a strong group also containing Belgium and world champions Spain. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Olivia confronts the boys with their worst nightmare: will they hand over their phones to their girlfriends?

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as 10 amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a coveted dream job as a junior fashion designer for high street giant M&S. Over six episodes, the competitors will be tested on their design, problem-solving, commerciality and collaboration skills and judged by a panel of senior leaders at the company alongside a rotation of celebrity guests and designers. In their first challenge, the contestants are tasked with creating womenswear clothing under the watchful eye of guest judge Mel B

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning

programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: James heads east to the region of Jura where he barbecues duck and uses the apple and pears of a local orchard. Plus, he visits the home of Comte cheese!

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Rishi Persad presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Pendil Novices' Chase from Kempton Park, plus the Eider Chase at Newcastle, and the Winter Derby from Southwell. Analysis from Luke Harvey and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and plus commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Johnnie Beattie and Ugo Monye, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Jim Hamilton, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman
